intro: Ervatamia yunnanensis var. heterosepala, commonly known as the Yunnan ervatamia, is a rare flowering plant native to southwestern China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and distinctive umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
